title: Deep elf master archer

|   | A deep elf archer who has devoted a lifetime to the mastery of archery, dismissing magic as a frivolous distraction. |

## Useful info

**Deep elf master archers** are deadly marksmen, dealing heavy ranged damage at lightning speed with their [bows](/Bow "Bow"). Unlike most deep elves, they have no magical capabilities to speak of. They can be found almost exclusively guarding the treasure rooms on the lowest floor of the [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls").

## Tips & Tricks

- Barring exceptional defenses, deep elf master archers with a clear line of fire will deal staggering amounts of damage very quickly (all the more so if they have a [branded](/Brand "Brand") bow). If you're playing a character who has trouble taking a hit or two, do what you can to keep *something* in the way of their arrows at all times unless you're actively killing them. A flood of summons works well, though weak ones will likely be mowed down almost as fast as you can generate them. Any [smite](/Smite "Smite")-targeted spell, however, is perfect here.
- Luring master archers around a corner is highly preferable to charging headlong into a stream of arrows. Fighting them from a [kill hole](/Kill_hole "Kill hole") is even better, but kill holes don't last long around [deep elf elementalists](/Deep_elf_elementalist "Deep elf elementalist").
- Unlike with some other archers (eg [centaurs](/Centaur "Centaur")), if you are adjacent to a deep elf master archer, they will *not* switch to a melee weapon, making them no less deadly at point-blank range. Of course, if you've got the archer next to you, then you can freely pummel them to death; they're lightly armoured and only moderately evasive.
- If you've found a [scarf](/Scarf "Scarf") of [repulsion](/Repel_Missiles#Player_sources "Repel Missiles"), the Elven Halls is a good place to wear it. [Reflection](/Reflection "Reflection") and a good [SH](/SH "SH") score can also be a boon here.
- If you have [curare](/Curare "Curare") [darts](/Dart "Dart"), this is a good time to use them, either to escape the pummeling or slow down the rate of fire to achieve a kill.
- A [scroll of fear](/Scroll_of_fear "Scroll of fear") can get a master archer off your back long enough to regroup, but not reliably; you'll probably need more than one and had better have reasonable [HP](/HP "HP") to begin with.
html:
Deep elf master archer

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.25: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all deep elves, see list of deep elves.

deep elf master archer e 
HP 49-100
HD 15
XP 2510
Speed 10 (msl: 50%)
AC 0
EV 15
Will 100
Attack1 25 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type elf, elf
Flags Archer
Speaks
Warm-blooded
Don't melee
A deep elf archer who has devoted a lifetime to the mastery of archery, dismissing magic as a frivolous distraction.

Useful info

Deep elf master archers are deadly marksmen, dealing heavy ranged damage at lightning speed with their bows. Unlike most deep elves, they have no magical capabilities to speak of. They can be found almost exclusively guarding the treasure rooms on the lowest floor of the Elven Halls.

Tips & Tricks

  • Barring exceptional defenses, deep elf master archers with a clear line of fire will deal staggering amounts of damage very quickly (all the more so if they have a branded bow). If you're playing a character who has trouble taking a hit or two, do what you can to keep something in the way of their arrows at all times unless you're actively killing them. A flood of summons works well, though weak ones will likely be mowed down almost as fast as you can generate them. Any smite-targeted spell, however, is perfect here.
  • Luring master archers around a corner is highly preferable to charging headlong into a stream of arrows. Fighting them from a kill hole is even better, but kill holes don't last long around deep elf elementalists.
  • Unlike with some other archers (eg centaurs), if you are adjacent to a deep elf master archer, they will not switch to a melee weapon, making them no less deadly at point-blank range. Of course, if you've got the archer next to you, then you can freely pummel them to death; they're lightly armoured and only moderately evasive.
  • If you've found a scarf of repulsion, the Elven Halls is a good place to wear it. Reflection and a good SH score can also be a boon here.
  • If you have curare darts, this is a good time to use them, either to escape the pummeling or slow down the rate of fire to achieve a kill.
  • A scroll of fear can get a master archer off your back long enough to regroup, but not reliably; you'll probably need more than one and had better have reasonable HP to begin with.

==Useful info==
'''Deep elf master archers''' are deadly marksmen, dealing heavy ranged damage at lightning speed with their [[bow]]s. Unlike most deep elves, they have no magical capabilities to speak of. They can be found almost exclusively guarding the treasure rooms on the lowest floor of the [[Elven Halls]]. 

==Tips & Tricks==
*Barring exceptional defenses, deep elf master archers with a clear line of fire will deal staggering amounts of damage very quickly (all the more so if they have a [[brand]]ed bow). If you're playing a character who has trouble taking a hit or two, do what you can to keep ''something'' in the way of their arrows at all times unless you're actively killing them. A flood of summons works well, though weak ones will likely be mowed down almost as fast as you can generate them. Any [[smite]]-targeted spell, however, is perfect here.
*Luring master archers around a corner is highly preferable to charging headlong into a stream of arrows. Fighting them from a [[kill hole]] is even better, but kill holes don't last long around [[deep elf elementalist]]s.
*Unlike with some other archers (eg [[centaur]]s), if you are adjacent to a deep elf master archer, they will ''not'' switch to a melee weapon, making them no less deadly at point-blank range. Of course, if you've got the archer next to you, then you can freely pummel them to death; they're lightly armoured and only moderately evasive.
*If you've found a [[scarf]] of [[Repel Missiles#Player sources|repulsion]], the Elven Halls is a good place to wear it. [[Reflection]] and a good [[SH]] score can also be a boon here.
*If you have [[curare]] [[dart]]s, this is a good time to use them, either to escape the pummeling or slow down the rate of fire to achieve a kill.
*A [[scroll of fear]] can get a master archer off your back long enough to regroup, but not reliably; you'll probably need more than one and had better have reasonable [[HP]] to begin with.
